instruction:
1) Apply fixes from the static-analysis recipe.
2) Retrieve details about the package rename.

1) Identify static analysis issues.
2) Retrieve recipe details using the identified fixes.

- Fetch details for migrate_junit4_to_junit5.
- Review the recipe details to extract actionable steps for implementing the migration.

Fix static analysis issues in ./projects/your-service.
Migrate to Spring Boot 3.3 in ./projects/your-service after fixes.
Plan the 2-to-3 migration for the Spring Boot project at ./projects/my-springboot-app, and then implement the 3.3 upgrade for the same project.

Fetch the Java 21 migration details.
Gather the Micronaut 2 to 3 migration details.
Fetch the details for migrating to Java 21. Then verify the log4j-to-slf4j migration details against the Java 21 changes.
Retrieve the Java 17 migration details for ./workspace/my-app, then apply the Spring Boot 1 to 2 migration recipe to ./workspace/my-app.

1) Review migrate_to_java_21_details.
2) Apply the manage_maven_dependencies_recipe.

Migrate the project at ./projects/legacy-erp to Java 17.
Update Maven dependencies for the project at ./projects/legacy-erp.

Fetch the JUnit 4 to 5 migration details.
Compare the JUnit 4 to 5 details with the Micronaut 2 to 3 migration details.

Review the details for fixing static analysis issues in the codebase.
Assess the details for migrating to Java 25 in your project.

2) Review the details about Java 17 migration.

Fetch the details for upgrading Spring Boot 2 to 3.
Review the JUnit 4 to 5 details in light of the Spring Boot upgrade.

- Document details of SLF4J parameterized logging usage.

Apply the JUnit4 to JUnit5 migration recipe to ./workspace/notification-service/build.gradle.
Next, display the Spring Boot 3.3 migration details.

Inspect the static analysis issues details.
Compare the migration details for Spring Boot 3.3.

- Then fetch details for package renaming.
